adversity: What happened in plain facts without opinions?
Where were you and who else was involved?
What led up to this moment step by step?
What did you observe with your senses?
What did not happen that you expected?
What part of this event is within your control?
What specific trigger set this off?
If a camera recorded this, what would it show?
belief: What did you immediately tell yourself about this event?
What meaning did you assign to what happened?
What rule or story about yourself or others did this confirm for you?
What prediction did you make right after it happened?
What assumption are you making about causes and motives?
If this belief had a headline, what would it say?
What label did you apply to yourself or someone else?
What are you taking as proof that may only be interpretation?
consequence: What emotions did you feel and how intense were they from 0 to 10?
What actions did you take because of the belief?
What actions did you avoid because of the belief?
How did this belief affect your body sensations or energy?
How did it influence your tone or words with others?
What short term result came from acting on this belief?
What long term effect might follow if this belief continues?
How did this belief impact your goals today?

evidence: What objective facts contradict or weaken this belief?
Are you confusing a possibility with a certainty?
What did you do well that this belief ignores?
Are you considering all the facts, or just the negative ones?
What is the strongest counterexample from your past?
alternatives: What are three other explanations that fit the facts?
If the cause were specific and temporary, how would you phrase it?
What factors outside you could explain part of this?
What skills or habits could change this next time?
What simpler explanation might be true here?
What would you say to a friend in the same situation?
usefulness: How helpful is this belief for your goals today?
What belief would lead to better action right now?
If you keep this belief, what do you gain and what do you lose?
What mindset shift would make you more effective in the next hour?
What version of this belief is both honest and motivating?
What action does a more useful belief point you toward?

energy: After disputing, what emotion is present now and how strong is it from 0 to 10?
What is the next tiny step you feel ready to take?
What thought now feels truer and more helpful?
What commitment will you make for the next 24 hours?
What physical cue tells you your energy has shifted?
What support or resource will you use to keep momentum?
What will you do if the old belief returns?
How will you measure progress from this new stance?
